name: Button Fern
description: Pellaea rotundifolia, commonly known as Button Fern, is a charming, compact evergreen fern native to New Zealand. It features distinctive round, dark-green leaflets arranged along arching fronds, creating an elegant, cascading appearance. The plant displays a compact, bushy growth habit and typically reaches 15-30 cm in height and spread when grown indoors. In its native habitat, it thrives in forest understories and rocky areas. The glossy, rounded leaflets give it a unique appearance compared to other ferns, making it a popular choice for terrariums and indoor plant collections. It's well-suited for terrarium environments due to its compact size and preference for high humidity. The plant is non-toxic and pet-friendly, making it safe for homes with pets.
careTips: Provide bright, indirect light - avoid direct sunlight
Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged
Water when top inch of soil feels dry
Protect from cold drafts and temperature fluctuations
Fertilize monthly during growing season with diluted fertilizer
